net.sf.opensftp.impl
Class SftpUtil

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opensftp.impl.SftpUtil
All Implemented Interfaces:
SftpUtil
public class SftpUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements SftpUtil

A reference implementation of SftpUtil.

Author:
BurningXFlame@gmail.com

Method Detail

setPrompter

public void setPrompter(Prompter prompter)
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Set the prompter property. Once a valid Prompter is set, the Prompter should be used in any scenario where a Prompter is supposed to be used.

Specified by:
setPrompter in interface SftpUtil
See Also:
Prompter

getPrompter

public Prompter getPrompter()
Return the prompter.

If the prompter is null, an instance of SwingPrompter will be created and assigned to prompter first.

Since:
0.3

setProgressListener

public void setProgressListener(ProgressListener progressListener)
NOTE: This concrete implementation of opensftp doesn't fully support ProgressListener. The progressListener param must be an BaseProgressListener. Otherwise, this invocation is ignored.

Specified by:
setProgressListener in interface SftpUtil
See Also:
ProgressListener

getProgressListener

public ProgressListener getProgressListener()
Return the progressListener.

If the progressListener is null, an instance of PlainProgressListener will be created and assigned to progressListener first.

Since:
0.3

chmod in interface SftpUtil
Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
mode - an three-digit octal number, 0755 for instance, representing the new permissions
path - The path representing the file or directory the permission of which is about to be changed.

an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation

connect

public SftpSession connect(java.lang.String host,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String identityFile,
                           int strictHostKeyChecking)
                    throws SftpException
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Connect to an SFTP server through the default port(22) using publickey authentication with empty passphrase. Invoking this method is equivalent to: 
 connect(host, 22, user, "", identityFile, strictHostKeyChecking)

Specified by:
connect in interface SftpUtil
Returns:
a SftpSession object representing the context information of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
SftpUtil.connect(String, int, String, String, String, int, int)

connect

public SftpSession connect(java.lang.String host,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String passphrase,
                           java.lang.String identityFile,
                           int strictHostKeyChecking)
                    throws SftpException
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Connect to an SFTP server through the default port(22) using publickey authentication. Invoking this method is equivalent to: 
 connect(host, 22, user, passphrase, identityFile, strictHostKeyChecking)

Specified by:
connect in interface SftpUtil
Returns:
a SftpSession object representing the context information of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
SftpUtil.connect(String, int, String, String, String, int, int)

connect

public SftpSession connect(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String passphrase,
                           java.lang.String identityFile,
                           int strictHostKeyChecking,
                           int timeout)
                    throws SftpException
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Connect to an SFTP server through publickey authentication.

Specified by:
connect in interface SftpUtil
Parameters:
host - Host name
port - Port number
user - User name
passphrase - Passphrase. An empty string ("") indicates no passphrase.
identityFile - The path of the identityFile. for security, it's strongly recommended to place your identityFile under the .ssh folder of your home folder, /home/yourusername/.ssh for Linux for instance. If you specify a value begining with '~' and a following directory separator ('/' or '\\'), the '~' is treated as your home folder.
strictHostKeyChecking - The strictHostKeyChecking option. Valid values for this param are SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_ASK, SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_YES and SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_NO.
timeout - the timeout in milliseconds. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
Returns:
a SftpSession object representing the context information of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException

connectByPasswdAuth

public SftpSession connectByPasswdAuth(java.lang.String host,
                                       java.lang.String user,
                                       java.lang.String password,
                                       int strictHostKeyChecking)
                                throws SftpException
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Connect to an SFTP server through the default port(22) using password authentication. Invoking this method is equivalent to: 
 connectByPasswdAuth(host, 22, user, password, strictHostKeyChecking)

Specified by:
connectByPasswdAuth in interface SftpUtil
Returns:
a SftpSession object representing the context information of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
SftpUtil.connectByPasswdAuth(String, int, String, String, int, int)

connectByPasswdAuth

public SftpSession connectByPasswdAuth(java.lang.String host,
                                       int port,
                                       java.lang.String user,
                                       java.lang.String password,
                                       int strictHostKeyChecking,
                                       int timeout)
                                throws SftpException
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Connect to an SFTP server through password authentication.

Specified by:
connectByPasswdAuth in interface SftpUtil
Parameters:
host - Host name
port - Port number
user - User name
password - Password. An empty string ("") indicates no password.
strictHostKeyChecking - The strictHostKeyChecking option. Valid values for this param are SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_ASK, SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_YES and SftpUtil.STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_NO.
timeout - the timeout in milliseconds. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
Returns:
a SftpSession object representing the context information of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException

lls

public SftpResult lls(SftpSession session)
Description copied from interface: SftpUtil
Represent the lls command. Invoking this method is equivalent to: 
 lls(session, ".")

Specified by:
lls in interface SftpUtil
Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a List<SftpFile> object, if this lls operation succeed.
See Also:
SftpUtil.lls(SftpSession, String)

Parameters:

path - The local path to be listed.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a List<SftpFile> object, if this lls operation succeed.

Returns:
